Uses of Class
it.polimi.group03.domain.StatusMessage

  • Packages that use StatusMessage 
    Package Description
    it.polimi.group03  
    it.polimi.group03.engine  

    • Uses of StatusMessage in it.polimi.group03

      Fields in it.polimi.group03 declared as StatusMessage 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private StatusMessage Test.rCode 

    • Uses of StatusMessage in it.polimi.group03.engine

      Methods in it.polimi.group03.engine that return StatusMessage 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      StatusMessage GameEngine.addBeadToBoard(Player player, Bead bead)
      This method adds a new bead for the selected player if and only if it complies with the rules established by the Game.
      StatusMessage GameEngine.addPlayer(Player player)
      This method adds a new player to the game if and only if it complies with the rules established by the Game.
      StatusMessage GameEngine.makeMove(int id, BarOrientation orientation, BarPosition targetPosition, Player currentPlayer)
      This method should be called when a player tries to make a move, before refreshing the state of the game, it will perform a validation according to the rules established for the game.
      private StatusMessage GameValidator.validateBarPositionMove(Bar selectedBar, BarPosition targetPosition)
      This method checks the intended movement of the bar with respect of the final position.
      private StatusMessage GameValidator.validateConsecutiveBarMove(Bar selectedBar)
      This method checks the movement that a player tries to do when there are only two players left in the game, in order to do it validates the selected bar against the bars slid in the two previous turns of the player.
      StatusMessage GameValidator.validateCurrentPlayerDifferentFromPreviousPlayer(Player currentPlayer)
      This method checks that a player does not play two times in a row.
      StatusMessage GameValidator.validateMove(Bar selectedBar, BarPosition targetPosition, Player currentPlayer)
      This method checks whether the movement a player is trying to do complies with the rules established for the game.
      StatusMessage GameValidator.validateNumberOfPlayers()
      This method checks if the number of player is valid i.e more than 1 and no more than 4.
      StatusMessage GameValidator.validatePlacedBead(Player currentPlayer, Bead newBead)
      This method checks that a player places a bead in an allowable position; in order to do so first checks the number of beads the player has already placed, then checks if the position of the new bead is valid i.e if the new bead is not placed in a holed slot or if there is already a bead in the selected slot.
      private StatusMessage GameValidator.validateSelectedBarMove(Bar selectedBar)
      This method checks that the bar selected by the player was not slid by any of his/her opponents in the previous turn.
